cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles N of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, forecast to turn north on Sunday and accelerate northeast toward the vicinity of Bermuda, then out into the North Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Bermuda (closest approach, not a definite landfall)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and Puerto Rico experiencing long-period swells; Bermuda likely to be most affected next week.
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force winds expected at St. Croix; strongest winds remain well north of the Virgin Islands.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only isolated showers; heavy rains associated with Jerry have moved away.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and dangerous rip currents along north-facing beaches.
